definition: to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: The company's products have no shoddy, low charge high.
sentences.chinese: 本公司产品绝无以次充好，以低充高。

sentences.english: Have a cellular phone and keep it charged, tell your friends where you are going and be safe.
sentences.chinese: 带着手机并充好电，告诉你的朋友你去哪并注意安全。

sentences.english: I couldn't finish developing film until midnight, since I took so many pictures.
sentences.chinese: 我拍了好多卷照片，因此直到半夜才充好底片。

sentences.english: Carry your cell phone and keep it charged -- and make sure to tell your friends where you're going and when you'll be back.
sentences.chinese: 带着手机并充好电，告诉你的朋友你去哪并注意安全。

sentences.english: Then, in building materials, buildings, the construction of shoddy work.
sentences.chinese: 然后，在建筑材料上以次充好，施工上偷工减料。

sentences.english: It usually take one hour to get my cellphone fully charged.
sentences.chinese: 使我的手机完全充好电通常要花一小时。

sentences.english: Filled cylinders should be held in quarantine until released by the qualified person.
sentences.chinese: 充好的气瓶应保持在待检区，直至有资格的人员放行。

sentences.english: In the evening, the New Yorker came back to his warm house with the full-recharged vehicle.
sentences.chinese: 下班的时候，再开著充好电的电动车回到温暖的家。

sentences.english: Check whether lubricant oil is already filled.
sentences.chinese: 检查润滑油是否已充好。

definition: to recharge (a battery)/(fig.) to recharge one's batteries (through leisure)/to update one's skills and knowledge
quantity of electric charge or current
to turn off (a machine or device)/to finish shooting a film
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
